intro: Munnozia hastifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf muhly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Munnozia hastifolia is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
